Very expensive for a parking pass, and very limited spaces. Also a hassle to get from one point to the other on campus.
There are so many events to go to every weekend. Whether you want to go out to the bars or hang out downtown Lawrence, there is always things to do.
Printers are available at all libraries and wifi throughout the campus. It makes being able to do homework very easy and adds to my academic success.

I am a part of Greek Life and I think it adds so much to the community, both locally and nationwide. There is not excessive partying and I personally believe it makes a big campus a smaller community for all who are involved.
There is all different people from different backgrounds that make KU very diverse and a place where anyone can find there place.
Sometimes the buses are on time and other times the buses are very inconvenient and walking is the best option.

There are days when campus is absolutely beautiful and it is an amazing atmosphere, especially in the fall. In the winter it sometimes gets depressing and it can sometimes get difficult to stay motivated.
The applications are straight forward and only contain the information that is necessary to what you are applying for.
KU has an awesome program for any major. The class work is very difficult, but in the appropriate amount of time is applied, anyone can be very successful.
Alcohol is as prevalent as it is on other campus', but if you do not drink, there is still plenty of other things to get involved in and do.
KU is extremely expensive and the people who give out loans expect my family to pay much more of my tuition than what is possible. It can be frustrating.
Internships are very competitive. They are practically a full-time job on top of school. I plan to look for an internship involving exercise science or PT to help further my academic career
Love everything that I have learned so far. My career is pretty inflated right now, so my only concern would be finding a place looking for a PT
Lots of Greeks running around campus. They seem to love it.
lots of student involvement during basketball season. A ton of school spirit in the spring (march madness). Athletic facilities are nice
Always something going on. If you're bored, its your own fault
Love my classes. Curriculum is great. Registration can be frustrating.
Lots of bus transportation all over lawrence
It all depends on the season. The middle of winter & summer can make for some uncomfortable walks on campus. Usually mild during other parts of the year
library can be crowded around midterms & finals.
A lot of security driving around campus. Walking between buildings can be intimidating due to lack of light. There have also been some off-campus attacks on women in the last 6 months
Great community. Friendly locals. Lots of places to eat and drink around town. Traffic isn't always great, but the people are laid back. Lawrence has a really cool liberal population
Lawrence is the best place in all of campus and one of the greatest secrets of the midwest.
Lawrence has some of the best and most unique restaurants around. There is always something new to try and different to eat when you're tired of the same thing.
I never had any major technological issues. My main gripe would be the high cost of printing, when we already pay high student fees. I feel like it should be free.

It depends what you want, if you're picky, your price range, and how many people you want to live with. There's something for everyone, its just sometimes harder or easier to find depending on those factors.

It is a close knit and authentic community of students and professors. Everyone becomes friends and relies on each other to get to the finish. Professors enjoy social activities with students but maintain professionalism. There are many unique speakers, trips, and internship opportunities.
I did not get in to my first choice academic school, but the second one I applied to happened to be the best and perfect place for me.
Most people have cars or can get rides with friends. The buses are popular and accessible but cars are the top.
Sports--especially mens basketball--is not just an event, but a way of life. Classes are cancelled for important games, tears are shed for losses, and tattoos are given for championships.
Greek life is important, but it's not necessary to join to have a social-life
I think the strictness is fair
KU basketball is an integral part of student life. KU wouldn't be the same without it
There are lots of labs and every library has computers and printers
Lots of international students and students of various backgrounds
I haven't looked into it too much, but the students I've talked to say that it is accessible and affordable
They require incoming students to complete an informational session about dugs and alcohol
I wouldn't be going here if it weren't for the scholarships that are available
There are plenty of options for college students that aren't too far from campus, and many of them deliver
Snow and ice are difficult on a hilly campus
KU basketball is widely popular. We have had one of the best programs in the nation for quite some time. We won the national championship for women's track last year as well.
There are plenty of opportunists for research, internships, and other types of experiences in the biological field.
I am pre-med, so I can imagine there will not be a shortage of jobs.
Plenty of things to choose from for a wide variety of preferences. Well-known for things like engineering, film, journalism, etc.
Lots of fraternities and sororities, which means lots of parties, but also a lot of people who view Greeks negatively.
Plenty of computer labs and libraries to visit. Plus there is great wi-fi in nearly every building on campus.
Bus routes make it easy to get around campus, especially in poor weather.
Often misdiagnosed and are not easy to deal with.
There are plenty of places to live and many of them tailor to college students' needs when it comes to cost of living and transportation.
Plenty of places to do things like bars, movie theaters, a venue for all types of concerts, and shopping.
Mostly it is parking that is unnecessarily strict. They are not forgiving for new students learning the ropes of where not to park.
A lot of chain restaurants, but there are many unique places as well. Tons of restaurants in close proximity to campus.
I have seen people get written up for drug usage in the dorms.
Good but bring your own computer
It is abundant but under control
Athletics are really important at KU
You can basically do whatever
Lawrence is a great place
There are many scholarships offered
there are many times that the buses come
There are many places to live when off campus
The reason I came here was because it wasn't some overbearing huge city. It has enough things to be considered a city but the atmosphere of a small town.

My roommate broke her foot and went to the student health center where they told her it was just sprained. Thankfully I still took her to the actually hospital later so she could get a boot and crutches because it was broken and not sprained.
Admission was pretty simple if you're in the top 10% of your graduating class.
The History department brings in a lot of speakers and a lot of them are actually pretty interesting.

The buses provided by KU take you all over Lawrence and it's all free and under your regular student fees. So use the busses. They are a great way to not waste your own gas and get around town easily.
I've never had Chipotle or Noodles and Company till I came here. Now they are the only places I eat.
History department is pretty awesome. Take anything and everything offered by Adrian Lewis. Learned so much from him.

It's literally the worst thing I've ever had to deal with. I got a scholarship but it was never applied to my current semester but instead to a previous one. Therefore I never actually got the $3k. Just worst ever.

Every semester you get $8 for free printing on campus. I've never used it all, but then again I have my own printer. But it's extremely useful if you forgot to print an essay before you left home. And they have these scanners that are literally a life saver. I use them more than I do the printers probably.

I'm only here during the fall and the spring so I only see the beautiful sunny weather. The only kick is the snow, but believe me that ain't gonna stop class. They will have that stuff plowed by 6am so you can still go to class.
There is a large level of diversity. With the numerous major choices and the large number of international students, there are a lot of people to meet.
I have had to walk a mile across campus at 11 o'clock at night before and never felt that I was in any danger.
One of the best parts about Lawrence is it's ENORMOUS selection of places to eat. Where you need a quick slice of pizza, an elegant dinner for two, or a great sports bar, there are a ton of options.
Although I have not had one, I have heard a lot about opportunities in my major for internships. All of which have been very well paid.
If I could do it all again, I would have picked this major right off the bat rather than coming in as an undecided engineer.

There is free wi-fi access pretty much everywhere on-campus. As an Engineering student, there are computer labs set aside specifically for us, so if I don't have my laptop or it died, I can easily get access to a computer if I need to.
Just as long as you don't act like a complete idiot, you shouldn't have any problems with breaking rules.
There is definitely a noticeable party atmosphere around campus, but it tends to taper off some as classes progress and people get more involved in their studies.
Lawrence is a great place with a cool, laid-back kind of feel practically wherever you go.
Mostly upper class white catholic students but there is still a variety on campus. If you want diversity, don't join the Greek system.
It's pretty reliable for the most part, but it's so much nicer having a car on campus.

The housing staff is ridiculously strict, the building is disgusting and the rooms are tiny. It's nice because the Oliver dorm is so awful that we all bond and probably have the best social atmosphere out of all of the dorms. Since our rooms are so small we all hang out together and go fun places. It's worth all of the bull that we have to put up with.
The school of psychology has a very easy admission process. Not a lot of requirements, very basic.
It's just your average program
It's pretty safe at KU, you can walk home alone and not have to worry about anything bad happening. But if you're in a frat or someone's apartment and can't leave, you're trapped.
Beautiful campus, everyone is pretty friendly. Parking is probably the only downside.

There is always something going on whether it's a house party, a giant frat party, a smaller frat party, bars, or clubs. There are always a lot of bars to choose from and the drink prices are pretty cheap. The strip clubs in Lawrence are pretty fun too.
Professors are generally pretty chill, classes are easy. It'd be nice to be challenged once in a while, but I guess that's what the honors college is for.
It's very unpredictable and student housing doesn't take care of the parking lots or sidewalks when it snows. It's awful.
Greeks are extremely cliquey with others in the Greek community. Non-greek girls and Greek girls generally get along well, but the same cannot be said for the guys.
There are so many good places on Mass Street
Lots of snow this year - glad I didn't go farther north.
Two new dorms are under construction.
Tech support has been very helpful
Excellent program, professors and fellow students. The SELF program is fantastic.
Excellent major - changed to 4 year program this year.
Lawrence is a great college town
Buses are great, a bit crowded but always an option
I am very happy with my major, its a challenge and I am supported well
The engineering school is very helpful with providing tutoring to those who need it
McCullom is quite dirty, old, and run down
Greek life is present but not a big deal, nothing bad
I have always felt safe on campus walking around.
Its available, but it can be difficult to find an opening
I can get online wherever and whenever I need to
Good scenery and friendly locals. Great busing system
It is ok, but it is inconvienent to leave campus, the on campus dining is good enough
There is lots of diversity on campus, lots of international students
Students are supportive of athletics and have great school spirit.
I don't use them much, but when I have, they are easy to get to and use.

There is a lot of housing available if you apply early. The cost is very high, $500 or more for a 1 bedroom, parking is usually a problem. Landlords range from horrible to pretty good. I hear horror stories about landlords not fixing things or cleaning up before a new tenant moves in, etc.
There is no shortage of things to do and places to go & there is always someone ready to go out.
It is cold and it's a long way to walk to class...usually up a hill.

You may see students using drugs & alcohol at apartment complexes, bars and houses, but not so much on campus. The tickets are expensive and campus police monitor parties pretty tight. The Greek houses seem to have more use on campus then most other groups.
The worst is the parking tickets. It's almost like the campus police wait and watch so they can ticket you.

The FAFSA is way too long...I did not apply for aid because my parents "make too much money" for me to get any aid except for UNsubsidized student loans. The people in the financial aid office seem to think that everyone knows what's going on and we don't. We need explanations, pointers and ideas.

There don't seem to be very many problems so I think they must be doing their job pretty well. I feel safe on campus and haven't had any issues at all. There is a really good presentation given at orientation that I think helps.

You know what's awesome? Being told "you don't have to come to class--I don't take attendance in my classes--but by missing, you might not end up being able to take tests and quizzes and stuff, which probably means you'll get a good grade."

KU respects most of its students as adults; instead of punishing them for minor infractions, it simply lets them reap the rewards of their actions. Fail to attend? You've screwed yourself. Break the parking rules? Eh, if you're caught, you're going to get the same kind of fine you'd get anywhere else.
I wouldn't know. Their houses look super fancy, but I personally don't care enough about chapters to get in one.

KU is one of, if not the most liberal school in the Midwest, to the point where it's ahead of most schools in terms of diversity. If you can think of it, it's probably here, and there's a sincere desire from the school to actively support and celebrate diversity as much as possible.
Where do I even begin? Lawrence is known for being a big party town--and with good reason. The sheer variety of stuff to do pretty much always means something's going on.

It honestly doesn't feel like they're going above and beyond to help you get what you need. At least they make sure you get your school money before school starts, rather than later, unlike the school I transferred from.

As a foodie, I value my off-campus cuisine, which is why I absolutely love Lawrence. They have EVERYTHING, and it's almost all good. My only complaint--my ONLY complaint--is that Tryyaki once gave me reheated fried rice late at night. Not cool.
Honestly, I don't see much drug use going on. I think the teachers mention smoking pot more than the students, which still isn't all that often.

My main complaint about the bus is that it tends to arrive either 30-40 minutes early or 5-10 minutes late. This can be great, if you're wanting to leave class--wait 15 minutes, ride home. But honestly, showing up to the bus stop and having the guy drive away just as you're walking up to the bus on a day when the temp is below freezing? Not cool.
I honestly have never felt unsafe on campus; my time in the medical center made it seem alright, but it's in an awkward location in relation to all the other buildings.
I'm really liking the school so far. The workload's pretty decent, the professors are easy to get a hold of, the TAs really seem to know their stuff. It's great.
The wind tends to always be blowing thirty miles an hour in the direction you're walking.
It's great it's easy it's fun.
This is a great school for Pharmacy and the program is awesome and there are always people there to answer any questions you have.

The bus system isn't bad except for in bad weather or when people decide to attend class. The buses stop for longer periods at some residence halls so that by the time they reach other halls they are full. On any given morning three full buses might pass you up before you get one. You have to get there pretty early to make it to your class on time.
its hard to find scholarships and i couldnt get many loans
KU Mens Basketball games have to be the best experience
we have a great academic program
only on weekends does it get bad
when its cold, walking sucks or when its super hot
a very old building, needs to be renovated
In my experience so far the academia at KU is great with plenty of teachers who really want what is best for their students.
There are plenty of undergraduate options at KU and they have a great career services center that helps students get started in careers.
Off campus housing is good with a few different options for apartment living but most are far to pricey for college students.
The local atmosphere of Lawrence is great and would absolutely love to live here after I graduate.
Campus dining is slightly above average but nothing to go crazy over plenty of spots to eat but most offer the same things.
If you don't about KU's basketball team I don't know why you are reading this but, Allen Fieldhouse is the best arena in college basketball and a cathedral to the sport.
I do not drive on campus but I know that permits are far to expensive and parking is an absolute joke but that is right on par for every college I've been to.
KU has a very good nightlife with plenty of parties and some great bars that are fun and cheap, only downside is not many options.
It's Kansas so expect a ton of windy days. Cold winters and hot summers.
The bus system at at KU is excellent and can get you pretty much anywhere around town.

I absolutely love this school and wanted to go here ever since I was little but the only think keeping me from giving them 5 stars is the complete unwillingness to grant out of state students in state tuition or at the very least lower the rates and add more scholarships.
Being known for their medical school it is no surprise that KU prides itself on their great Health and Safety.
There is a lot of drug and alcohol use at KU, but I don't think peer pressure to drink or use is a problem.
Speaking from personal experience I think there are far to little scholarships available to students especially out of state students.
The aesthetics on the KU campus are fantastic with plenty of great student facilities like Ambler Rec. and Anschutz Library with the best backdrop in america, Allen Fieldhouse.
I absolutely love the buildings at the KU campus it has some nice older buildings with lots of charm but also features many new and future state of the art buildings.

I don't have much experience with Greek Life at KU but I have never had any run ins with any of the Frats, that being said there is a general jealous feeling from some towards the frats and sororities.

In my experience with KU housing which is not traditional because I lived in the Jayhawk Towers which are much larger than traditional dorms and great but I have heard rough stories about the resident halls but cannot speak from experience.
There are plenty of great off campus restaurants my personal favorite for best food is Jefferson's while if you are more interested in atmosphere I would suggest The Burger Stand.
There are many different minorities at the University of Kansas but the amount of minorities is still a very small percentage compared to the amount of white Americans on campus.
One has access to a clinic but the quality is questionable.
We get occasial snow days but at most 2-6 days of snow days.
There is a lot of Greek life, but it is to the point that it isn't even special to be in one anymore. You are just fine if you are not in one.
I have never had a problem with the campus security so I have nothing to say. I have heard many different things though from other students.
I have only been around Engineers and guys at the gym which are two total opposites so I cannot really say.
A lot of fast food restaurants to choose from. But that's about it.
The housing is very poor in terms of building quality. The staff is nice which makes up for the buildings but they could still use some renovations.
I have heard that a lot of people have a pplied for it, but I haven't heard anything bad from it so far.
The fan support for the KU basketball team is fenominal.
The transportation options are great, especially in the evenings.
The specific majors are very supportive in the engineering department since there are so few students.
There are a lot of varying majors to choose from but none of them are that special other than the pharmacy major.
The computers available at the computer labs aren't the best, but they aren't bad either. The Engineering department could use some new computers, though.
The college community here is great. There are a lot of great people on campus who can help you out and a lot of activities to do that don't involve illegal activities.
You hear about drugs and alcohol being used at college parties, but if you don't want to partake in these activities it is easy to ignore them.
As an out of state student, I would think there were be more options. They provide a website with a list of scholarships.
Can be unpredictable but generally pretty nice. Sunny, warm
I think this campus is extremely diverse and overall a very accepting place.
I sometimes use the bus system. I think it's fairly easy if you figure out the times

I was once Greek, it was a great experience for the few years I was a member, but it wasn't the fitting lifestyle for me. I still talk to the women in the house and they love their renovations for the new house.
When it snows it's awful,, there are a lot if hills! But any other day the campus is beautiful.
There are always police out on Thursday- Saturday nights carding kids walking by and giving them breathalyzer tests.
I know that the city of Lawrence is very strict on underage drinking and drug use, which is awesome!
I only live three hours from home, so driving back is always an option for me.
There are so many apartment complexes weaved into campus. It would be difficult not to find a place!
I always see KU campus police. There are patrolling the majority of the time.
The process of getting into my program was very difficult. I was required to take a standardized test to rank me, along with an interview and many other difficult tasks.
The lengthy process was miserable. My one tip would be to get your FAFSA in on time.
The workload is very difficult, as well as the curriculum. The facilities are perfect for studying. There are many small rooms specifically for studying.

The majority of the professors have been practicing pharmacists so that's really inspiring. The process of applying for the School of Pharmacy was difficult which included answering essay questions, sending in letters of recommendation, PCAT test scores sent in, & an interview.
Allen Fieldhouse is known as the LOUDEST arena in the US. it's absolutely beautiful inside.
The school itself has so much pride! I'm currently in the School of Pharmacy & have learned so much!

There is a variety of people that attend the university of Kansas and no one is afraid to show their own style. At the same time, everyone is very respectful and I have not encountered anyone being a victim of bullying. Everyone is really cool and accepting. Everyone I have met has shown passion for what they do.

Campus crime is very slim, like any other college there can be a couple of incidents but overall security around campus is very efficient and safety services are usually very reliable. I feel relatively safe walking alone during the day, but at night it is always a must to walk with someone specially being a girl and campus being so big. There are not many lights throughout campus which makes it a little scary, but if walking with someone, you can feel very safe.
Everyone is so nice and respectful. Staff is always willing to help.
Every building is very well conserved and they are beautiful. Campus is absolutely incredible.
Best experience ive ever had has been in allen field house
Safety on campus is great nothing bad ever goes down
Variety of great food for greek to italian to mexican and so on

Some of the best I've seen and I've attended three colleges
Libraries are awesome here some of the best

Of course i would i love it here, basketball is crazy supported here and its one of my favorite sports

The bar/club scene is the best i've experienced anywhere!!
I love kansas weather you get to experience it all snow, rain, heat it is perfect
housing is great close proximity to campus, dorms are ok to small for my taste so i moved to a apartment and am loving it

I love the weather. It's pretty mild and fall is absolutely beautiful!

Love KU basketball and intramurals

The diversity of the campus is average, like every other college town has to offer. There's something for everyone though!
The campus dining halls are great and they all newly renovated! The variety differs from hall to hall but each hall has a great amount of vegan/vegetarian options.
The University has a very helpful staff that helps you with the financial aid process.

Even KU doesn't have a ranked football team the tailgating more than enough fun to make up for it. Basketball on the other hand is something that we are known nationally for and that experience itself makes campus that much better!

There plenty of computer available on campus, mac or pc! Especially with the amount of libraries KU has to offer there is always a computer available to use. KU has a great feature that you're allowed up to $8.00 of free printing on campus, and that goes a long way.
The main campus road is becoming better lit
The main issue is parking tickets
Students want to have fun while going to school
The libraries are resourceful and helpful

Many different options, and they're all fun

Off-Campus Housing is nice, but too far away
On campus the transportation is great and somewhat off campus but if you want to go any where after five or on the weekends a car is needed if it isn't within walking distance.
The only time I don't feel safe on campus is walking around campus at night on my own, but if I need I know I can always call Safe Ride.
The college atmosphere and local atmosphere is great! I love it!
Its chilly, but I wanted that drastic change. If you love snow and layers you've come to the right place.
There's always a bus available. 6am-5pm Monday-Saturday 7pm-4am everynight except Sunday
I never lived outside of the dorms so I couldnt tell you how great/bad it is to live off campus
If you're looking for a fun night go to a Frat party. If you want a relationship stay away from the Frats, but I promise you there are a ton of good looking smart guys who are boyfriend material.
If you leave the dorms early enough, getting a parking spot for class isnt so bad. They offer buses every day except Sunday from 6am till 5pm
I love the dorms. I wish I could do it all 4 years!
There were enough choices in scholarships but you better keep your GPA up the entire time you're in school!
Buffalo Wild Wings and Hot Box Cookies. Enough said.
Its average...It'll fill you up. Best night is definitely taco night!

I loved it! It was something different from sunny South Florida. The people were ridiculously nice and the teachers were an incredible help. Definitely worth every penny college could suck out of you (parents).
BASKETBALL GAMES!!!! ALL THE WAY! Great memories on Mass street and just living an ideal college life.
Fantastic teachers, TA's, and outside of class help.
There's a lot of stress with papers and assignments but hey that's college!
There are quite a lot of Frats that distribute excessive amounts of alcohol during parties. I see people coming into the dorms or just walking around campus drunk more than I ever expected.
I will be part of an internship, only because it is required for degree.
I totally repeat the experience, it is challenge and enticing.

The program is going well and interesting to partake in.
Have there own way of interacting with other students.
Many opportunities, but I feel there is not enough for the campus population.

I enjoy the academic opportunities connected to my major.
I enjoy the availability to professors help and advice.

I have no personal experience with this area of activity.

Plenty of things to do off campus, ease of access to off campus too.
Most peers are easy to get along with, but there are some who are a challenge.
I personally do not eat at campus dining regularly.
I have no permanent residence on campus, these are peer opinions.

Enjoyable experience in campus. I personally favor the opportunities on campus.
Decent defense road-wise, but could use more along pathway walking on campus.
Weather is all over the place, but the communication of temperature is easy to find.
Ease of access to alcohol, unknown about any other drugs available. Has not effected the students in class.
I can personally always find spots to park, except game days. Also distant from classes is pretty good.
It decent not actually living on campus, but attending is good.
Large area for classes to attended. Very flexible and easy access to scholarships.
So far its been great.
Depends on your personal experience with greeks. Im actually friends with a few.
Its all great and beneficial.
Living on campus is fun. Differs from hall to hall and the RAs can contribute to how much you like it.
The majors offered are pretty diverse and fairly challenging.
You can literally get into something every night.
Safe bus/ride is very reliable.
You can fit in wherever.
You can always find somebody to have fun with.
You can always find something to do.
The computers are good and reliable.
KU sports is the main reason I chose to go to school there, and it hasn't disappointed. Almost all students are huge fans of the athletics and actively support them by attending the games.
The night life has many options, and the bars have good deals to get large amounts of people to show up.
Although I have has terrible experiences with the health services, I do always feel pretty safe on campus.
Many people participate in drugs, yet to those who don't want to participate it can easily go unnoticed.
The greek life seems to be a big deal to those who are in it. Most students who aren't involved, like myself, think it is a waste of time and money.
The computer labs are average, but the network is very good and easy to connect to from a personal computer.
Getting into the biology program is not very complicated. The student basically has to have above a 2.5 GPA then sign a piece of paper.
I love KU. It is a good mix of challenging work, diversity, and a fun college atmosphere.
There are lots of different majors offered at the school, many of which are ranked highly in the nation.

The school work is challenging. Unfortunately you often run across professors that don't care about their students, but when you do get a good professor interested in your success then the class can be very fun.
There are always different speakers or events on campus to attend
The buildings are always kept clean and updated.
It is the perfect college town in my opinion. There is always different events going on that appeal to many different people.
I have never had too bad of an experience but it could always go more smooth. KU rarely offers any scholarships whatsoever.
There are a lot of options or different places to go with reasonable prices
Rooms are very small. Hot water was in showers were poor.

The police in Lawrence hand out parking tickets like free candy. The RAs in the dorms are strict about drug and alcohol use if they see them, but they don't go out of their way to find students using them. The police are rather strict about house party noise complaints.

The KU journalism program is one of the top 10 in the nation. I'm glad to be a part of the j-school where students collaborate but push each other to do better. I wish our broadcast program was more robust.
KU is ranked in many programs. The professors are very helpful and students can access tutors and study options that are good for them.
Though the bars and clubs are good and there is a variety, I wish there were other nightlife options.

While the university provides plenty of computers, it's much easier to have your own. This allows you to work any time anywhere rather than having to go to the lab. Students can access computers in dorms, Greek houses and many campus buildings. As a journalism student, I wish the university provided free editing software.

Guys at KU tend to look for hookups rather than relationships. They tend to look for drunk girls at parties to sleep with rather than talking to girls in their classes or activities. I'm dating a guy from Kansas State.
Kansas provides a great ACT scholarship that I received when I applied to the university. However, I wish that KU had its own database of all the available scholarships that students can apply for.

Lawrence is the quintessential college town. There are constantly bands playing and activities for students. It is also close to Kansas City, so students can make day trips if they have a car. Kansas State University is only an hour away, and many students have friends that go to Kansas State University.
The weather in campus frequently changes suddenly. The winds can make walking to campus difficult.
We invented basketball. Basketball is huge and football is improving. However, club sports are not promoted enough.
The dorms are clean and promote social interaction. However, the rooms do not provide enough storage space.
The bus service to get around the city is convenient, but the bus and train stations are not particularly convenient to campus. The airport is almost an hour away.

Greek life encourages social interaction and involvement. However, it can also encourage partying, though there isn't considerable pressure. The female rush process is stressful and should be revised.

Though alcohol isn't allowed in the dorms, it is easy to sneak past the RA's. Students do drugs in the dorms and some show up to class high. Very few are caught. Undercover police come to bars and give out MIP charges, but this deters few people.
As long as you aren't being stupid you will be fine. If you flaunt things you will get caught and get in trouble.
I received a good about of money from the school but it is very hard to keep your scholarships especially in a hard major which I am in.

I personally joined a fraternity and I love it. It was one of the best decisions I have made. Greek life is not huge but it definitely has a presence. It is also more than just parties, we have raised thousands for charity and do a lot for both the community and the school.
There are computers available for students everywhere. There is also wireless access pretty much everywhere on campus and it is fairly reliable.
Lawrence, Kansas is a great town. The locals love the college and vice versa. Kansas City is pretty close which means access to a big city and the sports etc. that come with it.
The winter is cold and the summer is hot but in between it is really nice. The weather can be irregular but its not awful.
Parking can be difficult to find and officials are pretty strict about permit parking but free parking is quite common and in good locations.
KU Basketball is one of the best known programs in the nation and the students come out in full force to support them. On game day the school spirit is ridiculous.
Mass. Street is full of restaurants and many of them offer student discounts. It is a bit far if you are a freshman at the dorms but there is a wide variety there and a lot of fun.
Being a Jayhawk is like nothing else. None of my friends at other schools get the same amount of school spirit and pride that comes with being a Jayhawk

The buses are all free and run pretty late then there is SafeBus that runs all weekend starting Thursday and goes till three in the morning. There is also SafeRide which runs all week and will give students rides late at night.
There is nothing like watching a game in Allen Fieldhouse. The tradition and the students make it an amazing experience.
There are plenty of places to go to hangout and the libraries are always a great place to go to study.
I definitely feel safe on campus but there are always those stupid people who try to start trouble when out on the town and its hard to prevent that.
KU is known for its basketball program and we recently drafted the number 1 pick: Andrew Wiggins
Lawrence is a chill college town.
It's been a mostly positive experience.
Buses are nice to have to get around campus.
KU is renowned for Study Abroad.
Great libraries and free rec center for students.
I hate the KAP program. The rest is great.
I'm happy with the English department.
They are liberal in the right ways.
There are attractive guys. I don't focus on that for I already have a boyfriend.
It gets old after awhile.
Mass Street is the place to go for variety & cost.
KU has their own police department. They are fast.
Lawrence transportation is pretty good for not being a big city. I also have a car so if I need to go somewhere off campus I will just drive. When I need to go somewhere on campus I take the bus.

There is a lot of diversity. I've seen life through many different point of views because of that. I've had the privilege to meet many international students and learn about their backgrounds and heritages.
The social scene is great, the campus life is great, the facilities are pretty average, and academic programs are good.

The libraries are great! Watson Library is my favorite place to study, the atmosphere helps me to get my work done efficiently. Campus traditions are awesome here, it's one of the best parts. I get goose bumps every time I watch the pre-game basketball video in Allen Field house. KU is a basketball powerhouse, so the traditions associated with that are absolutely awesome.
There are so many different kinds of people here, to many to generalize. The mainstream kind of girls are very preppy but are also very nice.

As a Greek, I am totally biased. Being Greek has been a great thing for me! It has helped me make friends, network, get involved on campus, learn professionalism, and all together become a more well rounded person. On average, Greeks have a high GPA than non-Greeks which has to prove something. Greeks love being part of the Greek community and see the positive sides which is hard for GDI's to see. GDI's general perception of Greeks is snobby and only good for partying which is not true. I know nice, respectable men and women from the Greek community that will being doing something worth while in their lives. It's a great thing to become a part of, I would strongly recommend it.
They are strict about things involving the safety of the majority of people.

I'm only in my fall semester of my freshman year but it really sucks.. I'm taking upper level Biology and Chemistry and its very challenging. Those courses take a lot of outside work to do well. I would be very pleased with B's in these courses.
The professors are alright. It's fairly obvious that they aren't here to teach, they are here for research.

I got a $4,000 scholarship over 4 years for my ACT score but I will likely loose my scholarship after the spring semester due to my GPA. To keep the scholarship you must maintain an average GPA of 3.4 which is difficult one you get into higher level or more rigorous courses.

Most of the time there are decent food options but being a picky eater makes it a little more difficult to put a variety in my eating habits. I often eat the same things over and over which gets old. I have a few favorite meals but other than that, everything is just okay.
I have not lived off campus but I know many people that are currently or have in the past.

I've had a great experience so far. I'm not fond of my classes but I do what I need to do to be successful. I currently live in an on campus dorm which has led to me meeting my best friends. Living in the dorms has by far been the greatest experience of college. I've met so many people and I absolutely love living here. I also joined the Greek community this fall and I love being a part of that. I have found a good balance between my studies and my social life. Finding something to get involved in on campus has made me more of a well rounded student and has helped me to keep my sanity with my difficult course load.

This university is known for being a party school, with that comes alcohol and drugs. Many students partake and also many students choose not to. It's completely up to you to decide what you want to do. Peer pressure isn't a big thing here, most people will respect whatever decision you choose to make about drugs and alcohol.

A computer is a necessity. Almost all homework is online and there are few places with computer labs. Printing is expensive so only print if necessary. The wifi is slow but there isn't any other options so you get used to it.

Lawrence is a great college town. There is a large variety of places to eat on Mass. St. which is close to the northeast side of campus. There are also many delivery options that will deliver to the University dorms. There are great restaurants all over down but the ones on Mass. St. are the most easily accessible without a car.

It's Kansas weather...for those who don't know, temperature changes throughout the day are very common in the fall and spring. Weather in the fall in spring is very unpredictable. In the summer it's very hot and humid, that usually starts in June and lasts through mid September. As for winter, it's different every year; Kansas winter can happen anywhere between October and April. Some winters are bitter cold, some aren't, and some go back and forth between bitter cold and mildly cold.
It's a college town with lots to do.
I don't see it at all.
Ku basketball is very important in school life.
I don' t know that much about it, but there are hundreds of students who are a part of Greek life so they seem to have a good time.
I'm having a very difficult time finding the proper financial aid to pay for schooling and I don' t want this to be the reason why I can't reach my goals.

We have one of the best college basketball programs in the country, a national champion track and field team, and a outstanding volleyball team. Our school is very supportive of athletics. We always seem to get the top basketball recruits year after year.

The parking permits are a reasonable price compared to other colleges across the country but it's very difficult to find parking because so many students have cars. Going around campus, one doesn't need a car really at all, but for a drive around the city is understandable.

I love all the opportunities I have when it comes to my environmental studies major. The workload I have for the classes dealing with my major are very substantial and I learn alot of meaningful material. I have gotten many intership requests and research opportunities to take advantage of.

I think most of the professors teach the material very well with some good, but challenging material that really works our brains. It's kind of simple to register for classes for the upcoming semester. We have numerous libraries across campus to accomodate all the studious student body.

Honestly I don't see that much but I know people who like to do those drugs but for the most part nobody tries to pressure me into doing anything I don't want to. The alcohol/drug enforcement is very poor because even though you aren't allowed to bring it in the dorms, there have been a number of people who have snuck it in.
Usually the weather tends to change alot because living in Kansas that's kind of what you have to expect. So it doesn't really affect me that much since I'm accustomed to this weather already.

I like living on campus because it's convient with my classes since I don't have a car and also I get to make new friends, such as my roommate who is a wonderful person. The dorm I live in is not overall too satifying but I can deal with it. I really like how social everyone on my floor is and that makes the flow of making friends alot easier. The cost is pretty affordable compared to the other dorms on campus and it's close to most of my classes, the rec center, and the basketball arena so that's very convient.

Campus life is the best here on KU... for those who want to lead a healthy, there's a rec center that's opened every day of the week. Libraries that are opened 24hrs a day to help students study. Being in the dorms is like having your own family here on campus that supports you emotionally and academically
There are a lot of unique things about my school... there is one of the best study abroad programs... great resource to help study and a lot of resources to claim a place in the global world
fun and friendly campus to be in
there's always a computer available to work on in the libraries and at the dorms. Printing is free at the dorm and it only costs 8 cents
The weather today is nice.. it's neither too cold nor hot.. just the perfect weather to be out for a football game.

There are so many Off-Campus Housing options! Most of them are very close to campus, and if not they are easily accessible by transportation. Many of them are very nice and cost efficient. A lot of them are in a safe neighborhood and have easy parking.
A lot of the students are very nice and considerate. There are a few that seem stuck up, but that is to be expected. There are a variety of looks at KU.
There isn't a lot of visibility at KU. Although most kids participate in drinking it is not something that people feel pressured to do.
I am not personally into the Greek Life, but for the most part I think it's something that's very big on campus. There are a ton of different housing options, and it all seems very organized.
The printing is very easy to use and for the most part is free. The wireless network usually works really well, but is a little slow at times.
The school as a whole tries to involve every single student in many of the activities. Everyone is very bright and helpful. They know a lot about the school, and how to get people involved.

There are so many events that students can attend. There really is a group for every single student to fit into. I feel very comfortable in talking to other students and staff and know I will get an appropriate response.
KU IS HONESTLY THE BEST!!! I can't see myself anywhere else!
Coming from MN the winters aren't as cold... But summer on the other hand is HOT
KU basketball is one of the best in the country, but then again basketball was invented here! The atmosphere at the games is the best!
If that is something you like to do, there are may options.
There are many places for students to hang out and plans are constantly be changed to benefit students.
There are many different opportunities available. Most students can find some organization where they fit in.
It doesn't seem like the university has very strict policies at times.
The school is very expensive. For the most part the only financial aid one can get is loans.
There are a variety of different things to do in town. It is very focused on college students.
Campus is very diverse. There are many different cultures on campus and they blend together fairly well.
There is a variety of food options, but it is all really expensive.
There is lots of Greek life available and they seemed to be involved in a lot of campus organizations.
There is lots of alcohol use, and it doesn't seem to be super enforced. At other times, it is really enforced.
There are not many places to park on main campus, but there are quite a few lots. Finding a spot during the day is difficult though.
There are many labs available, but the computers are usually slow and have a lot of things downloaded on them. Students are given some free printing, but it would be helpful if there was more given.
I feel relatively safe on campus, but do not walk alone at night.
The weather is always changing throughout the day so it is sometimes difficult to decide on what to wear in the morning.
The bus system on the University is great. It allows transportation to all parts of town.
The food at Mrs. E's is good, and on campus there are a wide range of food options. The downside is that the food on campus is extremely costly.
The off-campus housing is either costly and extremely nice, or moderately priced but trashy.
I absolutely love KU. The people are friendly, and those who pull the high school drama are usually the ones who drop out.
The walk to class is a pain, and the cost of the dorms is ridiculous. The meal plan is only used sparingly unless you live in Lewis.
The exercise facilities are very clean, and packed full of different exercise options.
It's Kansas weather, what would you expect? One day it's 100 degrees then it's 10 degrees.
Sometimes the work load for b.s. classes is a bit much, but I think classes are relatively easy.
The professors are all extremely helpful, but the TA's are a little hit and miss.
The atmosphere is a vibrant college town, but it is not overwhelming. Everyone is accepting of students, and the shopping is varied. There is a lot of interaction between KU and Haskell.

If you are under 18, you might as well get a fake ID or borrow a 21 and up ID from someone because none of the clubs will allow 18 -20. There are one or two nights a semester where there are 18 and up nights at the Cave.
There is a very diverse population at KU, and there is always a place for someone to fit in. Most people dress in leggings and a nice shirt. Girls and guys are both attractive and nice.

The traditions run within each students blood and walking on campus gives everyone chills. Basketball games are undeniable the most tradition based sport we have, and activities on campus are numerous. There is always something going on. There are always clubs to join and places to study.
Our building are very clean, there are lots of vending/ food options, and there is always something going on at Wescoe or the Union.
The only down side to Lawrence is finding a way to get to KC for a flight, train, or bus ride.
While in your dorm, Resnet is used, and it is the biggest pain to set up and get working. While on campus, everyone is on the Jayhawk network, but it constantly drops off.
There are various sororities and fraternities, and it is a huge part of KU. Everywhere you look on campus, there are 10 or more kids in a sorority or frat.
There are hardly any places to park on campus near classes or building for free. At Daisy Hill, a year long parking pass costs over $100, and there are very few parking spots at Templin.
There is a wide variety of ethnic and cultural cuisine, but many of them are pricy.
There is a lot of drug use, but they are trying to crack down on it in the dorms.
Some paths are unlit, and it is a little sketchy to walk alone later in the day. There are a lot of non-students on campus.
We are accepting of everyone on campus, and there is always someone to talk to.
They sound more strict about things than they actually are.

Wow where to even begin. KU has an amazing variety of dining on campus, located at every corner and almost every building! There are 5 dining halls for residence of the dorms, and varies other food courts find all over campus. From Pizza Hut to sushi, all is found on campus. The libraries have coffee shops which are open every day during great hours. My personal favorite has to be "The Garden" located inside the Kansas Union. Its a food court with so many different variety's to choose from one couldn't possibly try it all even if they went there everyday for a month! The prices are always reasonable and never ask too much, they accept all types of currency including credit/debit cards, cash, and meal plan cards. Overall if you're hungry take a walk on campus and you'll find something to crave your ever desire.

Campus strictness varies depending on where you live, what classes your'e in, what you're involved in, and how you go about your everyday life. Many classes that are held in lecture based meetings do not take attendance and do not baby you around. Some other classes that are smaller will take attendance and will affect your grade heavily. Dorms are all extremely strict on alcohol and will not tolerate it whatsoever. If caught with alcohol you will be written up and have a meeting with an advisor as to see your punishment. Usually a first offense will deem you community service, a second will be more serious, and a third is chance of expulsion. A student must be smart around here, you're not allowed to walk around with alcohol obviously or else you will get fined by the campus police which seem to be everywhere. Honestly I think its a good think because I feel extremely safe on this campus with the police here. They always keep order and know how to handle things. As for having visitors that is based on your dorms policies, my dorm I'm allowed to have people over as long as we aren't loud and distractive. Its nice lets you be in charge of your room so gives you a sense of maturity and ownership.

I love my school so much. Its incredible, it's such an honor to be a Jayhawk and something I wear with pride. The traditions here are incredible, from our amazing Alma Mater chant, to the history and creation of the modern sport of basketball, it was all created here. The studies and impact this University has had on our world is beyond me. My favorite experience so far would have to be watching Kansas football beat West Virginia this past weekend. That win snapped a 27-game conference losing streak, the worst in college football. We won in a thrilling game, stormed the field, and with the entire football team and Jayhawk family sang the famous Alma Mater that President Roosevelt fell in love with and named the best in the country. After the song was over we proceeded to tear down the field goal post in celebration, we walked it over to the nearby lake on campus, and like the many before us, followed the tradition and threw the goal post into Potter Lake. It was incredible to see the thousands of people all in this together as one giant family. From young to old all Jayhawks are the same. My only regret is not joining Greek Life earlier. The kids on campus that are involved in Greek Life always seem like they have something to do and are always involved around the University. I would 100% choose this school again, without a doubt in my mind. Im in love with being a Jayhawk.

The transportation services here at the University of Kansas are greatly designed. They have numerous pick spots all around campus and around Lawrence which is the college town around our campus. For example just in front of my dorm there is a pick up spot for the bus, and in the back of the parking lot there is another bus stop. Its extremely easy to figure out bus schedules and routes. The cost is one of the best parts, its free as long you're on campus and if you're off campus if you have your student I.D. on you its also free. Trains are located in the town of Lawrence and take you all the way downtown. Rideshares, and buses are always readily available if you need a ride to the airport or cities around the greater Kansas area. My only complaint would be buses don't run on sundays and have a limited schedule on saturdays, thats why I couldn't rate it five stars.

KU has all 4 seasons- Winter, Spring, Summer and Fall. The campus's architecture and design allows you to enjoy each season to it's fullest. There are hills for sledding during the winter. The Campus plants beautiful flowers everywhere that bloom in the spring and remind you of the upcoming summer holiday. Fall is my favorite season on campus because the trees burst into beautiful colors that accent the buildings and natural beauty of the campus. The transportation available to students allows us to get to and from activities, class etc. no matter what season we're in.

Campus police do a great job at policing for parking permits. They ticket if you are parked in an unauthorized spot without the correct permit.
It is fairly easy to create a new student club. You just have to have 2 or more people file a petition. Alcohol and drug use in the dorms is not permitted. There are strict consequences for breaking these rules. KU allows protests and demonstrations to take place on campus. I have learned quite a bit during these demonstrations.

Kansas City is less than 1 hour away and provides professional baseball, football and soccer teams. There are multiple museums and attractions in both Lawrence and Kansas City. Lawrence and Kansas City hosts multiple art and theater shows. Lawrence has a great music scene and indie film scene on Massachusetts street. Students have opportunities to see various bands and films for cheap affordable prices. Lawrence is proud of the University. There were numerous times when I have been out to eat with a friend and a family would offer to buy our meals because they knew we were students.

There is such a variety of off campus housing available for students. I have lived in apartments, houses and duplexes. The KU transportation buses pick up at the large majority of living areas which allows students to live off campus even without a vehicle. Living off campus allowed me to have a more peaceful living experience. When I needed quiet for studying, thats what I got. IT was perfect for me.

I felt the application process was very smooth. I researched the process for application, applied and received notification when the school had made their decision. The school has been great in communicating the process and answering any questions that arose.

My internship has been a positive experience. The University placed me with them and was instrumental in ensuring it was the right fit for both me and the agency. It is a non paid internship that is providing the necessary responsibilities and duties to fulfill my need for my degree.
I loveeee Lawrence's food! It is one of my favorite things! There is such a variety of cuisine and is very affordable.

There are quite a few bars and nightlife for University students. The 'strip' is not conveniently located near campus and would be hard to walk to and from. The campus has a taxi service called Safe Bus where they provide rides to students to discourage drunk driving.

I did not pledge so my knowledge is minimum about Greek life. My best friend was in a sorority and I did spend a lot of time at her sorority house. The house conditions were good, comparable to those of the dorms. The sorority sisters were very friendly and welcoming to me even though I was a non Greek. I would say it paints an accurate picture of the attitudes on campus. I did not view the Greek's any differently than anyone else. We are all Jayhawk's receiving the same education and proud of our school.

I did not partake in underage drinking or partake in any drug use during my undergrad at KU and still do not partake in drug use as a graduate student. I have never felt peer pressured to participate or left out for not participating. The school does a good job at educating the students about the dangers of underage drinking and drug use and discouraging them from participating. KU enforces strict rules when students are caught in such activity.

The campus has buses that are free for students to ride all throughout campus. There are a few buses available for off campus activities, but I would say to experience life outside of campus you would need a car. The campus is spread out but has been made very accessible for biking, walking and of course the buses are also available. For long distance transportation, a student would have to get to Kansas City (45 minutes-1 hour) to fly or ride the train.

The tech support and technology available is incredible. There are computer laps in almost every building on campus as well as multiple libraries that offer computers throughout. You can also check out laptops at libraries on campus. Wireless internet is available throughout the campus with the use of your student ID and password. The University provides $8's worth of free printing before charging a small fee for printing on campus.

The campus is beautiful! There are several locations to comfortably sit and study. The libraries are equipped with state of the art technology and has staff members present to help you work everything. One semester, my computer crashed and the library allowed me to check out a laptop to work on a paper for class.
The traditions that KU has surrounding sports, the Rock Chalk chant and academics are impeccable.

KU offers an exceptional education and has great traditions that embody their institution. The campus is absolutely beautiful and gives you a sense of pride, knowing you are a part of the beauty. My professors have always made themselves available for any questions, concerns and advice. When I see a Jayhawk, I hear the Rock Chalk Chant and feel a sense of pride that I am a part of such wonderful traditions.
There's a lot to choose from and prices are fairly reasonable.
They definitely make sure there's a variety of options and that vegans/vegetarians and considered.
All the facilities here are pretty great!
I haven't had many problems with girls on campus, but some of the guys here can be a bit rude.
You can definitely tell that many students take part in it, but housing definitely makes sure that nothing goes on in the buildings.
There are buses that take you from the dorms to your classes and even to other areas off campus. The only problem s that the on-campus buses stop at 5:30pm and the off-campus ones stop at 7:30pm.
There are soooo many majors to choose from!
The computers are pretty great. There are always ones available for you to use in just about every building and one of the buildings has free printing!
I've had a pretty good experience so far. There's a few things I would change but it has been fairly good overall.

It's pretty nice on some days. Doesn't get too cold but the wind here is crazy! Make sure you bring a jacket.. If you live in the Midwest it's just about the same as other places here, but the wind makes it a bit colder.

It is kind of hard to get into the classes you want/need since there are so many people at this school and not everyone has the same enrollment date. But the classes do cross over a lot and still count or help toward your major or toward the core curriculum.
There is a lot of work given and tests to be taken but the teachers seem to want to help students succeed.
It was fairly difficult. I had to talk to multiple people and set up many appointments to get financial aid.
Everyone here love sports, especially basketball. KU has one of the best basketball teams in the nation and basketball was invented at KU. Everyone has a lot of team spirit and supports the team!
The weather doesn't affect the experience much at all.

There is only a bus system for public transportation and it is extremely focused on getting students to/from campus only when school is in session. When school is not in session, the bus system becomes 1/4 the size and is extremely inconvenient.
Diversity seems mostly present on campus. There is clearly racial diversity though the rest are not as evident.
I feel safe on campus. For as many students as there are, there don't seem to be as much crime/violence as could be expected.
Basketball is definitely the biggest sport at KU. Every other sport is free to watch, but men's basketball requires camping out for tickets. Everyone accepts this because our team is so good.
There are labs and computers all over campus. As a design student, a downside is the cost of printing is expensive. I go everywhere on campus with my own mac.
There are a lot of foreign exchange students at KU. KU encourages students to embrace diversity and freedom of sexuality.
Living in the residence halls has a lot of restrictions. There's a lot you have to be careful of. Many students have gotten kicked out for disobeying rules.
Buses stop all around Lawrence at many times allowing students to be flexible with their schedule. A parking pass is a little expensive, but necessary for many.
I am double majoring. I don't regret it, but it is a challenge. With my dual major, I hopefully wont have too hard of a time finding a job.
I plan on having an internship this summer. I plan on studying abroad in Dublin. KU provides plenty of information about internships.
The weather really effects the walk to campus. Especially in the winter when students have to walk up a snowy, icy hill.
KU requires students to go through an alcohol and drug survey.
Expensive, but a lot of options. Three big dining areas on campus plus many small "hawk shops" around campus.
A lot of bars in Lawrence that are easy to walk to.
There are a lot of places for students, like the pond.

The KU greek community is very involved with various school and local organizations. Many greek students are on the student senate board, work on the newspaper staff, work as school ambassadors, etc. Some non-Greek students may see Greek students as partyers, snotty, or dumb. Although this is a perception for some, this does not apply to all of the Greek students. Many of the Greek students have the option to live in the Chapter house. But, of course these students have the option to live somewhere else. The chapter houses are right on campus. They are very large and decorative. The inside of the houses are very nice and clean.

KU, of course, is well known for its basketball. Now that it is basketball season, students have gotten more excited and hyped for sports. The students at KU are very dedicated to the men's basketball team. We have students camping out before games in order to receive tickets. At the games, students hold up posters made by the student newspaper. Being involved in men's basketball is a big Lawrence tradition.

Ku has a variety of different people that attend. There is not really any way to describe the "typical" students' look. There are students involved in the Greek Community that are very involved in Lawrence's community. A lot of the Greek students hold officer type positions in clubs or in Student Senate. Most of the greek students look like the stereotypical greek boy or girl. This includes preppy attire like polos, sperrys, and pastel colored clothing.

Lawrence, KS offers a variety of off-campus housing. I currently live in a duplex off campus with 2 other people. My duplex is roomy, clean, and located in a safe part of town. The only drawback is that I have to drive to school. Fortunately, I am able to park at a friend's off-campus house and walk to school from there. It is very affordable to live off-campus in Lawrence. Many students live in apartments that are far away from campus, but these students have the option to take the bus to school.
The weather during the fall and spring is awesome but the winters are brutally cold and the summers are pretty hot and humid
The process was long and i ended up having to go in to the financial aid office to talk with someone but once i did i got the aid that i needed
From my experience everybody usually pregames then goes out to the bars. The Hawk is a lot of fun to go to on Friday and Saturday, and the Cave is huge on Thursdays.
Atmosphere is great here so far, everybody is welcoming. Campus is beautiful during the fall, and the nightlife is a lot of fun
YOU ABSOLUTELY NEED A COMPUTER! There is tons of online stuff such as homework and reading that you need to do, and the library isn't reliable.
KU buses take you EVERYWHERE. Plus, everything is within walking distance. The only time you need to use our car is if you are in a hurry, and don't want to wait for the bus.
Our KU ID cards can be used for almost everywhere close in Lawrence, KS. It's very convenient, and reliable.
Parking is the only horrible thing KU has to offer. Everything else is found either on campus or on Mass St.
Regardless of what I am feeling now, I know this was the best fit for me.
KU is known as a party school. There are constant bars, and clubs down here that are fun. Well known bars host dollar night every week, which keeps the crowd pleased.
Financial aid would be easy to get if you knew what you were doing. KU had advisors to help assist, but since is does cost 18,000, it was fairly hard to come up with all of it.

I feel generally safe; I would feel safer if I wasn't a skeptic. But all-in-all, the police are visible, the health department is accessible, and there are safe buses and safe rides for Thursday-Saturday.
KU is by far one of the most accepting, diverse schools I have ever attended.
There is never a dull moment at KU. There is so much to do. From hanging out in the Kansas union, to walking down Mass. street, KU has it all.
Mrs. E's (my dining hall) is very accessible. It just depends on the day on the quality of the food.

Greek life is a big deal here at KU. But, like I mentioned before, if you aren't a greek, the girls don't want to talk to you at parties, but the guys are all for it. Freshman girls can't live in the houses, but the guys can.

The guys are more open to new friends, especially the Frats. Girls usually already have found their friend group within the first week, and don't really talk to anyone outside of their group unless they need to.

When they addressed us in orientation and meetings, they are fairly strict when it comes to the rules, they try to enforce them as much as they can. But as far as I see, it seems like anyone can get away with anything, but then again, I haven't seen much more than underage drinking, so maybe I only see the less strict opinions.
I applied for my financial aid and it went smoothly.
I don't really party but people who do seem to enjoy drinking and partying.
Everything is pretty much modern and campus is very environment friendly.
It's like any other high school but I would've preferred to have gone to a bigger school.
There always shuttles everywhere. Shuttles are convenient for everyone.
i really dont have to many guy friends but the ones i have met are very cool. not to out there, pretty laid back. alot of them are very smart . goes to class everyday and dont party hard to much.

the atmosphere of the city Lawrence is great. its very comfortable. everyone is friendly and kind. very helpful and nice. it is just a peaceful and fun place. i am really enjoying this experience and the opportunity to be here.

strictness on campus is good. really it keeps us safe and out of dangerous/ trouble. i would rather feel safe then to be scared because the people around me are drunk and make bad decisions. having rules dont always ruin the fun.

the good thing about my dining hall is that its a cafeteria downstairs so i dont have to travel to eat unless we decide to go out or something. but the food is good. they try to change it up from time to time and healty food is always available. its always food for veggies and friends and ect.

my overall experinece so far has been great. i met alot of people from all over the world. i live in a new and totally different environment. i love it out here and i feel like i can deal with this for four more years of my life while i get my degrees.

the weather is changing around this time but its not bad. some people are getting sick but i try my best to go to class everyday. it hasnt start snowing yet but even in the rain its buses that take you to class so there shouldnt be a reason not to go to class.
The sports here are big. everyone loves them and show support. its not all about the sports but they still get showed alot of love.

the first time i applied for aid it went through but they said i didnt go online and accept my aid but i did it just did not go through. so i had to put in a reinstaement form and send it off to my school. im still having problems but we are working on it now.

there are alot such as sports training, nursing, business, engineers, ect. anything you want to do basically KU has it. this is one reason why i choose this school because even if you dont think what your doing now is what you really want to do you always can change it.

for my major it come times were you have to put in alot of hard work. its alot of biology dealing with it partically. also you have to be very dedicated to what you are doing because this takes alot of time and effort.
to be in the program i am in now is awesome. you learn about about people and your health and the body. also you help people out alot. i really enjoy helping others.
i have not had an internship yet.
the parties around campus are fun. they are safe. it is always a way to and from parties so you dont have to drink and drive.

to live on campus for me is very different. sometimes i feel alone because i know now that i have to be independent moving to a town by myself without my mother. but my friends and the people in my surroundings are very helpful. they also are very kind and willing to help in sense of directions and much more. its alot of fun things always going on around campus, i feel safe where i live and it is also very peaceful.

i feel very safe on campus no matter what time of day it is. there are alot of open places you can go. there are emergency phones throughout the pathway while your walking around campus. theres numbers you can call if you need help. also there officers riding around throughout the day.

There are buses that take you to and from class. safe bus on weeknights and weekends. bus shuttles are also available to the students. taxi come in use. transportation is very easy to find and the times are great so you have a ride to and from where you need to be at that time. i love the transportation at our school. no matter what the weather is you know you have a way of getting around.
Lawrence has got some good restaurants close to the school.
Nightlife is good, but Lawrence struggles with its small town roots.
They are doing a ton of work on campus. New engineering and business buildings, new dorms and dining halls. That being said, there are quite a few buildings that need to be renovated.
I love the classes at KU, and there are tons of opportunities to get help if you need it.
At KU, most of the professors are outstanding, however, there are some who could use some improvement. Workload for my Business major is pretty heavy.
everyone is pretty nice and friendly

the school is strict enough on certain issues involving peoples safety but when you start giving parking lots away for sporting events when people need a place to park and you get tickets for it even though you paid for a parking pass is ridiculous
the architecture program lacks studio space in marvin hall and money getting more computers that have the software needed
internships for architecture are not easy to get but the school definitely helps the students make contacts and find internships that can be all over the world.
On campus drinking has never been seen by myself personally except in the dorms.

there are many computer labs around campus. i spend my time in the architecture lab because the have the programs that i need because it is so specific to my degree. i wish some of the other computer labs had more architecture related programs on them.
it is crazy with kansas because we can experience all 4 seasons in a week.
restaurants are one of the best things about lawrence. there is a lot of variety and you can find hidden gems that can be described as a best kept secret in lawrence.

it is very difficult for an architecture student to get the financial aid being from missouri because of the reciprocity program. I came into the architecture program my sophomore year and was paying full tuition with my financial aid instead of a prorated price because i did not go through architecture orientation. It is a very flawed system for architecture student not entering the program on the first year.
KUs campus is extremely diverse and does not discriminate against anyone

campus life is pretty good but there is no central hub on campus. the unions are on opposite sides of the campus and wescoe beach becomes the hub and there is nothing really close to it except the underground which gets super crowded and not an enjoyable place to hang out in busy times
There was a small amount of confusion as far as having me apply for financial aid on both campuses (Lawrence and KUMC), but it was easily worked out and I was happy with the outcome.
Lawrence is a great community.
Food quality isn't always the best. Also, its very expensive for a college student.

I am very happy with the business program. I know the outlook on my future will be good because I got the training I needed at one of the best schools in Kansas. Business is everywhere in our world so I have no doubt that I will be able to ind a good job that will allow me to be happy.

I do plan on having a internship mainly because it's required for my mayor and because it helps gain experience in the field. I don't have any concern at all that I won't find a internship because KU has many opportunities for students to find internships. They have job and internship fairs throughout the year so there is always a opportunity.

At the university of Kansas the business program like all the other programs offered here are A+. The faculty and staff are very dedicated to help ever student succeed with each of the programs they offer. They help you find a job in your designated field and help you prepare for life outside of college. KU is probably one of the best schools in Kansas and I am proud to be a Kansas Jayhawk.

I am in the KU School of Journalism, which is rated one of the top in the country! The difficulty level is pretty high, but it is rewarding once the classes are over and you realize how much you have learned.

Although there are several parking garages and lots, i ave found it easier to find a spot near campus, that way you dont have to pay for a pass, and you can be near. As a senior, I live in a house two blocks from campus, o I rarely have to drive anywhere other than work.

For me it was very difficult to receive financial aid due to my father's wages. Though my father makes a pretty penny, I was forced to figure out a way to pay for college on my own, and financial aid was a necessity. The offices at KU were sometimes helpful, depending on who you talk to, but ultimately I did everything online, on my own. I received most of the money to cover my college tuition, but I still have had to figure out a way to pay for living expenses, as well as the additional $4,000 in tuition that financial aid did not cover.

There are alot of housesand apartment complexes to choose from, but it is important to do some research before settling with one you think you may like.
